column4: I say "Gnome" like roam. Why do Americans say it thus: "Guh-noam"
the G in GNOME stands for GNU. GNU is pronounced guh-noo
I note that this isn't an American/non-American thing.
The GNOME developers as a whole don't care either way, so one isn't really more "wrong" than the other these days. The original pronounciation, however, was guh-nome.
